analysis: To determine the likely winner of this Best of 1 match between Vitality and HEROIC, I will analyze the following factors: 1) Team stats and world ranking, 2) Recent form and event history, 3) Map pool strengths and veto predictions, and 4) Relevant news articles. Vitality has a significantly higher win rate (76.43% vs 59.18%) and kill-death ratio (1.14 vs 1.04). They are also ranked #1 in the world compared to HEROIC's #14. Vitality is on a 30-match win streak and has won their last 6 tournaments, including IEM Dallas where they swept MOUZ 3-0 in the final. HEROIC has shown good form recently with wins at MESA Nomadic Masters and CCT Global Finals, but their losses to Aurora and Falcons at IEM Dallas show vulnerabilities against top teams. In terms of map pool, Vitality has dominant win rates on Anubis (81.2%), Mirage (86.2%), and Nuke (87.5%), while HEROIC's best maps are Mirage (67.6%) and Dust2 (61.1%). Given that Vitality is the higher seed (home team), they will start the veto process. Likely veto sequence: Vitality bans Train (their weakest map), HEROIC bans Nuke (Vitality's strongest), Vitality bans Dust2 (HEROIC's second best), HEROIC bans Anubis (Vitality's best), leaving Mirage as the most probable map to be played. On Mirage, Vitality has an 86.2% win rate compared to HEROIC's 67.6%. News articles suggest Vitality is in exceptional form with ZywOo performing at MVP level, while HEROIC may be distracted by rumors of SunPayus and sAw potentially leaving for G2 after the Major.
